required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Dermalax Implant Plus
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Subject and Evaluator Blind, Split-Face Comparative Medical Device Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Dermalax Implant Plus to Restylane速 Sub-Q for Correction of Nasolabial Folds

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to verify that Dermalax Implant Plus is not inferior to the reference device, Restylane速 Sub-Q, in terms of efficacy and safety in the correction of nasolabial folds

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement of wrinkle severity system scale(WSRS) scores of both Dermalax implant plus and Restylane速 Sub-Q Group
primary_outcome.description: Improvement of wrinkle severity system scale(WSRS) scores at week 12 compared to baseline by independent evaluator using photos.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement of wrinkle severity system scale(WSRS) scores of both Dermalax implant plus and Restylane速 Sub-Q Group
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of wrinkle severity system scale(WSRS) scores at week2, week8, week 16, week 24 compared to baseline by independent evaluator using photos.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects whose Global Aesthetic improvement Scale (GAIS) scores improved
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects whose Global Aesthetic improvement Scale (GAIS) scores improved at week2, week 8, week 12, week 16, week 24 evaluated by investigator at site

secondary_outcome.measure: 100 mm visual analogue scale (VAS) scores evaluation
secondary_outcome.description: 100 mm visual analogue scale (VAS) scores at both nasolabial folds evaluated by subjects at application of the devices

other_outcome.description: adverse events, laboratory test, physical examination

arm_group.description: Subject injected in the nasolabial folds of one side of the face in the initial treatment period.
Subject injected in the nasolabial folds of one side of the face in the initial treatment period.

intervention.description: Dermalax implant plus injection into one nasolabial fold(NFL) of one side of the face(blinded, split-face study design) in the initial treatment period.
Restylane Sub-Q injection into one nasolabial fold(NFL) of one side of the face(blinded, split-face study design) in the initial treatment period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female subjects no younger than 30 and no more than 75 years of age.
2. Subjects who scored 3 or 4 on the Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS) and want to improve the appearance of their nasolabial folds (the subject does not need to have the same score on both sides.*)
*The scores need not to be same on both sides, but the two nasolabial folds should have symmetry in the range of 3-4.
3. Subjects who have symmetric nasolabial folds.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who received an antithrombotic agent within 2 weeks prior to screening (with the exception of low dose Aspirin less than 300 mg/day)
2. Subjects who have a history of bleeding disorder.
3. Subjects who have received calcium hydroxyapatite, CaHA injection in nasolabial area.

overall_official.affiliation: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine
